title: 112_s3335
content: The Act may be cited as the "Effective Administration of Criminal Justice Act of 2012". The Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to include a comprehensive State-wide plan for improving the criminal justice system, involving consultation with various stakeholders. The State-wide plan for improving the criminal justice system must include details on funding allocation, evidence-based data gathering, and updates every 5 years with annual progress reports. The Attorney General will provide technical assistance to States and local governments for developing and implementing strategic plans for improving the criminal justice system. This assistance includes ongoing assessment of need, discussing goal accomplishments, and reflecting on how the plan influenced funding decisions in the previous year. The Attorney General will provide technical assistance to States and local governments to meet Sixth Amendment obligations, including public dissemination of justice administration practices and assistance with implementing compliant systems. Authorization of $5,000,000 for fiscal years 2013-2017 to uphold Sixth Amendment rights. Unlawful for any governmental authority to deprive individuals of assistance of counsel as protected by the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments. The Attorney General can take civil action to address violations of the Constitution, obtaining relief to eliminate patterns or practices. This provision will take effect two years after the enactment of the Act.
